joint.n.01.defn: (anatomy) the point of connection between two bones or elements of a skeleton (especially if it allows motion)

articulation.n.02.defn: the shape or manner in which things come together and a connection is made

roast.n.01.defn: a piece of meat roasted or for roasting and of a size for slicing into more than one portion

joint.n.05.defn: junction by which parts or objects are joined together

joint.n.06.defn: marijuana leaves rolled into a cigarette for smoking

expl: he warned against the use of narcotic drugs
skilled in the utilization of computers
the function of an auger is to bore holes
ballet is beautiful but what use is it?
he put his knowledge to good use
the consumption of energy has increased steadily
consumption.n.03.defn: (economics) the utilization of economic goods to satisfy needs or in manufacturing

expl: she had a habit twirling the ends of her hair
long use had hardened him to it
habit.n.02.defn: (psychology) an automatic pattern of behavior in reaction to a specific situation; may be inherited or acquired through frequent repetition

expl: his manipulation of his friends was scandalous
manipulation.n.01.defn: exerting shrewd or devious influence especially for one's own advantage

expl: we were given the use of his boat
use.n.07.defn: (law) the exercise of the legal right to enjoy the benefits of owning property

expl: they had an agreement that they would not interfere in each other's business
there was an understanding between management and the workers
agreement.n.01.defn: the statement (oral or written) of an exchange of promises

expl: there was no agreement between theory and measurement
the results of two tests were in correspondence
the two parties were in agreement
agreement.n.03.defn: harmony of people's opinions or actions or characters

expl: they made arrangements to meet in Chicago
agreement.n.04.defn: the thing arranged or agreed to

agreement.n.05.defn: the determination of grammatical inflection on the basis of word relations
